Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit his first home run of the postseason in the bottom of the seventh inning to extend the Yankees' lead to 6-2.
Gerrit Cole got out of a bases-loaded jam in the fourth inning.
Tanner Bibee allowed three runs (two earned) on five hits and a walk with two strikeouts in 1 1/3 innings.
Clay Holmes got a boost in the seventh from Judge, who hit his first home run of the postseason.
Aaron Judge hit a deep fly ball for a sacrifice fly to extend New York's lead to 3-0.
Gerrit Cole started the game with four shutout innings and got out of a bases-loaded jam in the fourth.
Clay Holmes ended the top of the fifth inning with a bases-loaded strikeout of Austin Hedges.
Aaron Judge launched a 1-1 Hunter Gaddis fastball over the center-field wall at Yankee Stadium for a two-run shot.
Tanner Bibee was finished after securing just four outs.
Cade Smith came in to face Judge and did the best he reasonably could in the situation.
Tanner Bibee's night was done after he recorded four outs.
Cade Smith pitched a 1-2-3 third inning, and the Yankees fail to plate a runner for the first time in Game 2.
The Yankees held a 3-0 lead after three.
Tanner Bibee allowed three straight hits, including an RBI double from Alex Verdugo, to start the second.
The Guardians intentionally walked Juan Soto to load the bases for Judge.
Aaron Judge hit a deep fly ball for a sacrifice fly to extend New York's lead to 3-0.
Clay Holmes struck out Austin Wells to end the inning.
Cade Smith struck out Anthony Volpe swinging to end the inning.
Gerrit Cole recorded three quick outs, including a strikeout of Will Brennan, to get out of the inning unscathed.
Tanner Bibee got out of the jam with strikeouts of Austin Wells and Jazz Chisholm Jr. and a nice play in foul territory by right fielder Will Brennan on a Giancarlo Stanton fly ball.
Gerrit Cole's off to a strong start. A 1-2-3 inning with a strikeout of Kyle Manzardo retires the top of the Guardians order.
Pre-Game Insights: Gerrit Cole will start for the Yankees.
Tanner Bibee will start on the mound for Cleveland in Game 2.
The Guardians have dropped starting pitcher Alex Cobb from their postseason roster because of a back strain.
He'll be replaced by Ben Lively, who posted a 13-10 record in the regular season with a 3.81 ERA and 1.245 WHIP in 29 starts.
Gerrit Cole posted a 3.41 ERA and 1.126 WHIP with 99 strikeouts in 95 innings of a regular season that was limited by injury.
Tanner Bibee posted a 3.47 ERA and 1.117 WHIP with 187 strikeouts in 173 2/3 innings pitched in the regular season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees secured a 6-3 win to take a 2-0 lead in the ALCS.
The Guardians are in desperate need of a Game 3 victory after losing the first two games.
The series now shifts to Cleveland with the Yankees holding a 2-0 ALCS lead.
Game 3 begins at 5:08 p.m. ET on Thursday.
Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians used eight pitchers on the night and are surely thankful for the day off on Wednesday.
If there's any solace for Cleveland, it's that Bibee will likely be available for another start sooner than expected after he threw just 39 pitches Tuesday.
The Yankees had two baserunners but failed to add an insurance run in the eighth inning.
Brayan Rocchio hit a two-out single, but the Guardians failed to score in the eighth inning.
The Yankees added one run but wonder what might have been after base-running errors produced two outs in the sixth.
Jazz Chisholm got picked off at second base after leading off the inning with a double.
Then, with two outs, Anthony Rizzo got caught in a rundown at third base to end the inning.
Austin Wells has become one of the better defensive catchers in baseball.
He struggled at the plate in September and has been quiet offensively so far this postseason, but letâ€™s take a moment to appreciate the defender Austin Wells has become behind the dish.

This was a guy many scouts projected as a likely future first baseman or corner outfielder when he was a top college prospect at the University of Arizona, yet here he is as a rookie, already one of the better defensive catchers in baseball.
That incredible block of a Clay Holmes slider with the bases loaded to prevent the game-tying run from scoring in the top of the fifth was the latest remarkable example of Wells' standout glovework.
Others: The Yankees' starting lineup for Game 2 was announced, with Gerrit Cole on the mound.
The Guardians' starting lineup for Game 2 was announced, with Tanner Bibee on the mound.
The series is now tied at 1-1 after the Yankees won the first game.
The Yankees are looking to take a 2-0 lead in the series.
The Guardians are looking to even the series at 1-1.
